answerText: Myoglobin [10] Named for a Danish physiologist, this effect explains how actively metabolizing tissues produce acid, which promotes O2 release where it is most needed. It shifts oxygen binding curves to the right.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | University of North Carolina, Truman State A, and University of Toronto | 2 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer the following about oxygen-binding affinity,  [10] Unlike the sigmoidal oxygen binding curves of hemoglobin, this compact globular protein which stores oxygen in muscles displays obeys a classical Michaelis-Menten-type substrate-saturation curve.
